column2: The Fellowship is a leadership development program for high-school-aged leaders who want to become the civic innovators that humanity needs.
column3: Juntos: small groups, led by mentor-like figures, that meet on a weekly basis to discuss what they are learning/get to know each other. We could do juntos, but have them be led by mentors that also sync 1:1 with explorers on a bi-weekly basis. In juntos, Explorers could discuss their independent learning journeys + important web3 x social impact projects.

column2: An intensive 4-month program, based in NYC, that equips young leaders with the knowledge and experience to be the climate innovators our world needs.
column3:
→The Leadership Blueprint: an advanced personal development tool that helps people learn about themselves. https://www.notion.so/9fdefed3197d4044972c64d4698210fc?pvs=21 is what it looks like. We could have explorers complete the LBP to learn about their you-shaped holes in web3 x social impact. 
→Selection Process: The application searches for demonstrated knowledge and passion, rather than experience (because most people will not have any). It also lets people get innovative. https://mt6bgkxo.paperform.co is the application.  
→Climathons: Each week, juntos compete in climathons against other juntos to tackle real-world problems + eventually have a portfolio to show to their internship site. We could do weekly hackathons.

column2: A PhD is a globally recognized postgraduate academic degree awarded by universities and higher education institutions to a candidate who has submitted a thesis or dissertation, based on extensive and original research in their chosen field.
column3: Original research: In a PhD, students enter with a topic and by the end produce new knowledge on the topic. Explorers could enter with a specific question and “explore” it throughout the program to eventually produce a piece of content (document, video, lecture, etc)

column2: Codecademy is an American online interactive platform that offers free coding classes in 12 different programming languages including Python, Java, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, SQL, C++, C#, Swift, and Sass, as well as markup languages HTML and CSS.
column3: Application: Every time you learn something on Codecademy, you have to apply it through writing code. I think we should use the same approach to the Explorers Program: every time someone learns something it must go towards building something, they must apply it.

column2: Caterpillar Inc. is an American Fortune 100 corporation that designs, develops, engineers, manufactures, markets, and sells machinery, engines, financial products, and insurance to customers via a worldwide dealer network.
column3: Reverse mentoring: Junior employees mentor senior employees. Because web3 x social impact is so nascent, even mentors have a lot to learn. We should structure the mentoring so that its not so extractive/one-sided, the mentor and mentee should be co-learning.
